item.title: Tech workers call for CEOs to speak up against ICE after the killing of Alex Pretti
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: More than 450 tech workers from companies like Google, Meta, OpenAI, Amazon, and Salesforce have signed a letter urging their CEOs to call the White House and demand ICE leave our cities.

item.title: Microsoft announces powerful new chip for AI inference
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: Maia comes equipped with over 100 billion transistors, delivering over 10 petaflops in 4-bit precision and approximately 5 petaflops of 8-bit performance — a substantial increase over its predecessor.

item.title: Nvidia invests $2B to help debt-ridden CoreWeave add 5GW of AI compute
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: CoreWeave will also integrate Nvidia's products across its platform, including the new Rubin chip architecture.

item.title: SpaceX eyes mid-March for first test of upgraded Starship rocket
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The launch date had been up in the air after the rocket's booster stage suffered an explosion during testing in November.

item.title: Only 5 days left: Over half of the first 500 TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 +1 passes at 50% off are already gone
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Register now to save up to $680 on your TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 pass and get a +1 ticket at 50% off. Offer ends this Friday, January 30.

item.title: Apple’s new AirTag is louder and can be found across longer distances
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Apple's new AirTag is louder and supports better finding at longer distances.

item.title: Nvidia’s new AI weather models probably saw this storm coming weeks ago
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Nvidia announced three new AI weather tools today. Together, they promise to improve the accuracy of weather forecasts while also making them accessible to more users.

item.title: Synthesia hits $4B valuation, lets employees cash out
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: British startup Synthesia, whose AI platform helps companies create interactive training videos, has raised a $200 million Series E round of funding that brings its valuation to $4 billion — up from $2.1 billion just a year ago.

item.title: This founder cracked firefighting — now he’s creating an AI gold mine
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The nozzle is just the beginning – what company founder Sunny Sethi calls "the muscle on the ground.”

item.title: ChatGPT is pulling answers from Elon Musk’s Grokipedia
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Information from the conservative-leaning, AI-generated encyclopedia developed by Elon Musk’s xAI is beginning to appear in answers from ChatGPT.

item.title: Humans& thinks coordination is the next frontier for AI, and they’re building a model to prove it
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Humans&, a new startup founded by alumni of Anthropic, Meta, OpenAI, xAI, and Google DeepMind, is building the next generation of foundation models for collaboration, not chat.

item.title: Science fiction writers, Comic-Con say goodbye to AI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.category: science fiction and fantasy writers association
item.description: Some of the major players in science fiction and pop culture are taking firmer stances against generative AI.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: RIP, Tesla Autopilot, and the NTSB investigates Waymo
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Apple will reportedly unveil its Gemini-powered Siri assistant in February
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: We’re about to get our first real look at the results of the recently announced AI partnership between Apple and Google.

item.title: What is Bending Spoons? The little-known firm behind Vimeo’s sweeping layoffs
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Bending Spoons remains largely unknown, even as its portfolio of products has served more than a billion people.

item.title: Google says it’s fixed Gmail issues with spam and misclassification
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: If your Gmail account doesn’t seem to be working properly today, you’re not alone.

item.title: Tech CEOs boast and bicker about AI at Davos
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: There were times at this week’s meeting of the World Economic Forum when Davos seemed transformed into a high-powered tech conference.

item.title: Former Googlers seek to captivate kids with an AI-powered learning app
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Sparkli said that education systems often fall behind in teaching modern concepts. The company wants to teach kids about topics like skills design, financial literacy, and entrepreneurship by creating an AI-powered learning "expedition."

item.title: SEC drops lawsuit against Winklevoss twins’ Gemini crypto exchange
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has dropped its lawsuit against Gemini, the crypto exchange founded by Trump backers Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss.

item.title: A new test for AI labs: Are you even trying to make money?
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: It’s getting hard to tell which AI labs. are actually trying to make money. We created a rating system to help sort it out.
